meanings.definition: To plant (a plant) in a new pot.
meanings.sent1: She carefully repotted the flower into a bigger pot.
meanings.sent2: I repotted the succulent to give it more space to grow.
meanings.sent3: The plant was so happy to be repotted, it practically waved its leaves in joy.
meanings.sent4: The act of repotting the plant felt like giving it a fresh start in life.
meanings.sent5: With each repotting, the plant seemed to thrive and bloom even more beautifully.

meanings.definition: To transfer (a plant) to a new pot.
meanings.sent1: After repotting the cactus, it looked much happier in its new home.
meanings.sent2: I repotted the fern to ensure it had enough room for its roots to spread.
meanings.sent3: The plant whispered 'thank you' as I repotted it into a larger pot.
meanings.sent4: Repotting the flowers was like giving them a ticket to a bigger and better world.
meanings.sent5: The act of repotting symbolized growth and renewal for the plant.

meanings.definition: Having been planted in a new pot.
meanings.sent1: The repotted orchid looked stunning on the windowsill.
meanings.sent2: The repotted herbs thrived in their new containers.
meanings.sent3: The repotted plant seemed to be showing off its new pot to the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The repotted succulent stood proudly in its fresh pot, soaking up the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The repotted flower seemed to sparkle in its new home, radiating happiness.
